resources.string: Hello player! This game puts you in the skin of a student on an intensive software developer course. You\'re changing careers, so your objective is to get to the end of the course to be able to get a new job. The course is 16 weeks long, so you need to keep focused and balanced all your stats to succeed. Remember, too high is as bad as too low.
This shows your Social Life level
You have succeeded on completing the whole intensive software developer program. You invested tons of time and money, but thanks to that, now you have become a junior developer

This app was developed during week 9 of the CodeClan intensive programming course. Based on a card game project brief, I have tweaked the idea into a simulation game. The player receives a card representing an event during the (parodic) daily life of a bootcamp student and their decision will affect a set of stats (money, sleep, anxiety, social life). If they are not balanced, they drop the course and the game will finish.
MVP is to have the Game logic developed in JAVA, and afterwards, as an extension, this will be transferred into a basic Android UI. As a final task, the ability to load/save the game and a ranking log with past game scores recorded with SQLite through Android Room.
Icons made by dDara from www.flaticon.com are licensed Creative Commons BY 3.0
If you\'re interested on looking at the source code, I encourage you to access the GitHub repo I posted on the following link: https://github.com/DetectiveAzul/codeclan_student_simulator
